_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:33:31 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of inpatients warned about medication side effects to watch for on discharge changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of inpatients who reported not being warned about potential medication side effects has decreased steadily from 45% of surveyed patients in 2009 to 41% in 2014. Also in the latest year of data, 61% of patients were not completely told about medication side effects to watch out for when they went home and is an area for potential improvement.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients
